metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To evaluate the effectiveness of routine biopsy of the transitional area in patients undergoing early systematic sextant biopsy. PATIENTS AND METHODS Two biopsies were taken from the transitional area further to a sextant biopsy in 164 consecutive patients. 98 cases had serum PSA levels higher than 4 ng/mL and 66 suspicious rectal digital examination. RESULTS Cancer was detected in 77 patients (46.9%). In 28 (36.4%) cases cancer was found only in the peripheral area, in 2 (2.6%) in the transitional area and in 47 (61%) in both areas. CONCLUSION Routine biopsy of the transitional area in early systematic prostate biopsy appears to be little effective. This would probably be indicated for patients undergoing rebiopsy.
metadata.dc:title: Utilidad clínica de la biopsia rutinaria de la zona transicional en el diagnóstico del cáncer de próstata.
[The clinical usefulness of routine biopsy of the transition zone in the diagnosis of prostate cancer].
